channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Merck/J&J deal may help US get enough vaccine for all adults by end of May
item.description: Merck will dedicate two facilities to making the newly authorized J�J vaccine.

item.title: Cuttlefish can pass the marshmallow test
item.description: Cuttlefish that were better at self-control also performed better on learning tests.

item.title: Intel hit with $2.2 billion patent judgment
item.description: Patents claim methods of varying voltages and clock frequencies to save power.

item.title: Dish tries to disrupt SpaceX’s Starlink plans as companies fight at FCC
item.description: Dish is trying to “expropriate the 12 GHz band” for itself, SpaceX tells FCC.

item.title: Microsoft issues emergency patches for 4 exploited 0-days in Exchange
item.description: Attacks are limited for now but may ramp up as other hackers learn of them.

item.title: AWS director sues Amazon, alleging systemic racism in corporate office
item.description: Amazon talks up inclusion in public but fails behind the scenes, suit claims.

item.title: Samsung will soon ship Micro LED TVs, but Mini LED still leads the lineup
item.description: Plus, a rundown of the wacky buzzwords you have to know to shop for these TVs.

item.title: “Locked” for 300 years: Virtual unfolding has now revealed this letter’s secrets
item.description: Practice of intricately folding letters to secure them is known as “letterlocking.”

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Bose headphones, Assassin’s Creed, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has portable Bluetooth speakers, board games, and the iPad Air.

item.title: Rookie coding mistake prior to Gab hack came from site’s CTO
item.description: Site executive introduces, then removes, insecure code, then hides the evidence.

item.title: Epic continues its studio-acquisition spree, buys Fall Guys devs
item.description: Free-to-play? Steam changes? “Nothing to announce right now!”

item.title: Google-free /e/ OS is now selling preloaded phones in the US, starting at $380
item.description: If DIY flashing isn’t your thing, refurbished Samsung devices are now available.

item.title: It Takes Two hands-on: Impeccable co-op platforming—on mute, at least
item.description: It may be Hazelight’s best-playing game ever, but it’s likely the company’s dumbest.

item.title: The Volvo C40 Recharge is a stylish new variant of the Swedish EV
item.description: 50 percent of all new Volvos will be electric by 2025, 100 percent by 2030.

item.title: Biden administration puts a price on carbon
item.description: The results of his first environment executive orders are coming in.

item.title: Trump’s is one of 15,000 Gab accounts that just got hacked
item.description: GabLeaks includes 70,000 messages in more than 19,000 chats by over 15,000 users.

item.title: Why N95 masks are still hard to get, even though production is up
item.description: Both supply and demand are up—but they aren’t lining up in the right places.

item.title: “We knew T-Mobile couldn’t be trusted,” union says after 5,000 job cuts
item.description: T-Mobile claimed Sprint merger would create thousands of jobs “from day one.”

item.title: Minisforum U850—solid hardware and easy upgrades in a little box
item.description: This mini-PC is VESA mountable, easy to work on, and attractively priced.

item.title: Sony’s brighter A90J OLED TV makes its way to living rooms this month
item.description: Like LG’s latest, Sony claims higher brightness than we saw in previous OLEDs.

item.title: Blue Origin’s massive New Glenn rocket is delayed for years. What went wrong?
item.description: The big delay can be traced to a decision Jeff Bezos made years ago.

item.title: YouTube’s TikTok clone, “YouTube Shorts,” is live in the US
item.description: US users can now upload and view one-minute videos in a swipe interface.

item.title: Archaeologists discover “Lamborghini” of chariots near ruins of Pompeii
item.description: The ornately decorated pilentum was likely used for festive processions, weddings.

item.title: Hacker reduces GTA Online load times by roughly 70 percent
item.description: Homebrewed DLL solves inefficient parsing of in-game shop files.

item.title: Verizon tells users to disable 5G to preserve battery, then deletes tweet
item.description: Verizon’s now-deleted tweet said using 4G only will conserve battery life.

item.title: B.1.1.7 variant now 10% of US cases—and cases are once again ticking up
item.description: “Things are tenuous,” CDC director says, as experts fear a fourth surge.

item.title: Humanitarian airship seeks world’s most powerful hydrogen fuel cell
item.description: LTA Research and Exploration is Sergey Brin’s airship company.

item.title: The 2008 moment when triumph turned to torment for SpaceX
item.description: Flight Three of the Falcon 1 rocket could make or break the company.

item.title: Pure nonsense: Debunking the latest attack on renewable energy
item.description: What a terrible anti-renewable-power video reveals about the US energy market.

item.title: Action-packed meta-fantasy, space opera herald a bright future for Asian film
item.description: Chinese A Writer’s Odyssey and Korean Space Sweepers make for a great double feature.

item.title: All the little things that add up to make iPadOS productivity a pain
item.description: Apple did a good job with the big stuff, but myriad little things undermine that.

item.title: Inside the stunning Black mythos of Drexciya and its Afrofuturist ’90s techno
item.description: The history of an experimental music-and-mythos project with Black Diaspora at its core.

item.title: Clubhouse’s security and privacy lag behind its explosive growth
item.description: The platform has promised to do better after a string of incidents.

item.title: FDA authorizes J&J COVID vaccine after unanimous vote [Updated]
item.description: An FDA advisory committee voted Friday 22-0 in favor of authorization.

item.title: As important as the Beetle? Two days with Volkswagen’s electric ID.4
item.description: It’s a competent but not flashy crossover with a real-world range of 250 miles.

item.title: Creator or Creature? A Nightmare Wakes dramatizes the birth of Frankenstein
item.description: Ars chats with director Nora Unkel about the origins, themes of her first feature film.

item.title: Atlantic currents seem to have started fading last century
item.description: Another predicted impact of climate change may be here.

item.title: Nikola admits to making “inaccurate” statements under disgraced founder
item.description: Under new leadership, Nikola is trying to become a viable truck maker.

item.title: Perseverance’s eyes see a different Mars
item.description: The red planet’s red looks different to a robot with hyperspectral cameras for eyes.

item.title: Hackers tied to Russia’s GRU targeted the US grid for years
item.description: Sandworm-aligned group has breached US critical infrastructure a handful of times.

item.title: Hard-coded key vulnerability in Logix PLCs has severity score of 10 out of 10
item.description: Critical authentication bypass flaw affects the entire Logix product line.

item.title: TikTok agrees to proposed $92 million settlement in privacy class action
item.description: Class members can get compensation, as long as most don’t file for it.

item.title: Report: Stadia undershot to the tune of “hundreds of thousands” of users
item.description: “The amount Google was willing to spend came as a shock to veteran game developers.”

item.title: Netflix drops extended Shadow and Bone teaser, announces release date
item.description: The fantasy series is adapted from Leigh Bardugo’s bestselling “Grishaverse” novels.

item.title: Pokémon Legends: Arceus’ stealth-infused open world hits Switch in 2022
item.description: Switch remakes of DS-era Pokémon Diamond and Pearl also announced.

item.title: A 3rd shot? A new booster? Vaccine makers race to trials to beat variants
item.description: Could a 3rd shot of current COVID vaccines be enough to thwart variants?

item.title: Texas woman sues Griddy after being charged $9,546 for 19 days of power
item.description: Griddy blames state agency as variable-rate plans produce outrageous power bills.

item.title: Best Buy lays off 5,000 workers as it shifts focus to online sales
item.description: The pandemic has accelerated Best Buy’s transition to selling online.

item.title: Google’s Smart TV software will have a “dumb TV” mode
item.description: “Basic TV” mode is coming to integrated Google TV sets from Sony and TCL.

item.title: Live chat: Ars Texas on living through last week’s arctic adventure
item.description: Check out the chat recap.

item.title: Report: PS5 storage expansion will be available by summer
item.description: Users should be able to load-in their own PCIe 4.0-rated M.2 drives.

item.title: Maryland school district places largest-ever order for electric buses
item.description: We might not be getting many EV mail trucks, but a lot of EV buses are on order.

item.title: Hands-on with Stellantis’ new Android-based Uconnect 5 infotainment
item.description: More and more OEMs are switching to Google’s operating system.

item.title: Rocket Report: Cornwall says “LOL, no” to space tourism, Korean rocket on track
item.description: “If we were to entertain this it would be quite ridiculous.”
